intro: Pedicularis filicifolia, commonly known as the fern-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its fern-like leaves and distinctive, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
